Most of the time, you use a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrinterPickerController] object to retrieve a printer object representing the printer selected by the user. # UIPrinter

**Class**

A printer on the network.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIPrinter
```

## Overview

You use a printer object to obtain information about a printer so that you can display that information in your app’s interface. You do not use printer objects to communicate with the printer directly.

Most of the time, you use a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrinterPickerController] object to retrieve a printer object representing the printer selected by the user. If you already have a URL containing the address of a printer—perhaps one that was previously selected by the user—you can use that URL to create a printer object directly. When creating your own printer objects, you must connect to the printer using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrinter/contactPrinter(_:)] method before retrieving any of the printer’s attributes.

## Creating a printer object

- **init(url:)**: Creates and returns a printer with the specified location.

## Getting the printer’s address

- **url**: The full address of the printer.

## Getting the printer information

- **displayName**: The human-readable printer name.
- **displayLocation**: The human-readable text that describes the location of the printer.
- **makeAndModel**: A string that contains the manufacturer’s name and the model name of the printer.
- **supportedJobTypes**: The capabilities of the printer.
- **UIPrinter.JobTypes**: Constants that indicate the types of jobs that the printer supports.
- **supportsColor**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the printer supports color printing.
- **supportsDuplex**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the printer supports printing on both sides of a sheet of paper.

## Connecting to the printer

- **contactPrinter(_:)**: Connects to the printer and gathers information about its capabilities.

## Constants

- **UIPrinter.CutterBehavior**: Constants that specify the cutter behavior of a roll-fed printer.

## Job info

- **UIPrintInfo**: Information about a print job that the system uses when it prints.
- **UIPrintPaper**: The size of paper for a print job and the rectangular area that the content prints within.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
